problem_text: Given \(x(t)=v_0\cos\theta\,t\) and \(y(t)=v_0\sin\theta\,t - \tfrac{1}{2}gt^2\), (a) compute the speed \(v(t)\). (b) Find when the speed is minimum and compute that minimum.
diagram_request: Trajectory with tangent velocity vector at time t; show minimum-speed point at apex.
solution_steps: Compute v²(t) then minimize v² instead of v.
